You should spend a few minutes meeting the support staff here at the Tower Base.

Start with Rutgar, the merchant. He's south from here, near the center of the base.

And just between you and me, you've got "tacit approval" to ignore anything that arrogant Helier asks you for. He's the pigling around here.

Welcome, recruit! I'm Rutgar, and I can be your best friend around here.

On this island, there are two kinds of soldier: those who replenish their supplies with me before combat...and "casualties."

On an island like this, mastery of magic is paramount. Helping recruits attain such mastery—or attain adequacy, at any rate—brings a smile to my face.

Anyone who desires magic instruction need look no further, but I have no talent for the brutish "art" of waving sharp objects around. That's Gurney's responsiblility."Got it."

Is Elleon really missing again? For a "federation hero," one would assume he knew how to leave a note.

Of course, what does "federation hero" even mean anymore?

Such mystery and such beauty on this island. Yet so many secrets.

Perhaps the biggest secret: why would the titans hide this beautiful island?

And the second biggest secret: Why would the titans reveal it?"Hmmm..."

The island is a gift to us in many ways, and I teach recruits how to gather the island's gifts for later use.

Do not let a humble instructor keep you from your appointed rounds, however. Duty calls!
